sentence.Network_en: Mr Morris said the victims had suffered from a very grievous mistake.
sentence.Network_cn: 莫里斯先生说遇难者因为一个极其严重的失误而遭遇不幸。

sentence.Network_en: Their loss would be a grievous blow to our engineering industries.
sentence.Network_cn: 失去它们将会是对我们工程行业的一个沉重打击。

sentence.Network_en: They were both found guilty of causing grievous bodily harm.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们两人都被判造成他人严重人身伤害的罪名成立。

list.abs: this too is a grievous evil As a man comes , so he departs , and what does he gain , since he toils for the wind ?这也是个大不幸：他往来一遭，除了劳碌捕风，到底得到了什么呢？
英语单词grievous是什么意思... ... a grievous fault 重大过失 grievous news 噩耗 a grievous railway accident 严重的火车事故.
... grievous faulty 【法】 重大过失, 重过失 grievous injury 【法】 严重伤害, 严重损害 grievous wounding 【法】 严重伤害.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French greveus, from grever (see grieve)

entry.tran: 极其严重的；令人担忧的
entry.def: If you describe something such as a loss as grievous, you mean that it is extremely serious or worrying in its effects.

example.ex: Their loss would be a grievous blow to our engineering industries...
example.tran: 失去它们将会是对我们工程行业的一个沉重打击。

example.ex: Mr Morris said the victims had suffered from a very grievous mistake.
example.tran: 莫里斯先生说遇难者因为一个极其严重的失误而遭遇不幸。

entry.tran: 剧烈的；极痛苦的；疼痛难耐的
entry.def: A grievous injury to your body is one that causes you great pain and suffering.

example.ex: He survived in spite of suffering grievous injuries.
example.tran: 尽管身受重伤，他还是活下来了。

means.word_mean: 1. causing fear or anxiety by threatening great harm;
2. causing or marked by grief or anguish;
3. of great gravity or crucial import; requiring serious thought;

sentences.sentence: "faced a grave decision in a time of crisis"
"the weighty matters to be discussed at the peace conference"
"no excess was too monstrous for them to commit"

auth_sentence.content: We have before us an ordeal of the most grievous kind.
auth_sentence.res_content: We have before us an ordeal of the most grievous kind.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We have before us an ordeal of the most grievous kind.

auth_sentence.content: Eke in foote and hand A grievous gout tormented him full sore.
auth_sentence.res_content: Eke in foote and hand A grievous gout tormented him full sore.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Eke in foote and hand A grievous gout tormented him full sore.

auth_sentence.content: "That would be a grievous mistake," said Gallucci to reporters.
auth_sentence.res_content: "That would be a grievous mistake," said Gallucci to reporters.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "That would be a grievous mistake," said Gallucci to reporters.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 严重伤害的,引起痛苦的
stems_affixes.word_buile: griev重+ous……的→adj.严重伤害的,引起痛苦的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 悲伤,悲痛;悲伤的事,悲痛的缘由

stems_affixes.word_buile: grieve悲伤+ance表名词→说悲伤的话→牢骚

stems_affixes.value_cn: 令委屈, 令苦恼, 侵害
stems_affixes.word_buile: ag加强,增加+grieve[v.使悲伤,使伤心]→加重烦恼

sentences.en: Her death was a grievous shock.
There was once a grievous famine in the land.
sentences.cn: 该国曾经发生过一次大饥荒。

sentences.en: He was charged with maliciously inflicting grievous bodily harm.
sentences.cn: 他被控蓄意严重伤害他人身体。
